official-title.#text: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide for a Medicare established provider system under which providers of services and suppliers representing a low risk for submitting fraudulent Medicare claims are provided certain claim review protections.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, in the case of a provider of services or supplier designated as an established provider under this section with respect to a period the following protections shall apply:

With respect to a claim submitted during such period for payment under this title for items or services furnished by such provider or supplier, which is subject to review for whether or not payment should be made under such title and with respect to which an additional documentation request has been issued, payment under this title for such claim may not be withheld unless a final determination has been made that such payment should not be made.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , repayment of such payment shall be made electronically by the provider not later than 45 days after notification of such decision. In applying the previous sentence, if the
determines that repayment within such 45-day period would result in a significant hardship to the provider involved, the
may, on a case-by-case basis, extend the 45-day period described in such sentence by such number of days as the
determines appropriate in accordance with a specified repayment plan.
